channel.title: [PI] How to make it so you need an certain slayer level to weild an item
channel.description: Hey everyone, I was wondierng if you know how I make it so you need 80 attack & 70 slayer to weild a "Chaotic rapier", If you know how to do this please explain. Thanks, Eraa

item.title: [PI] How to make it so you need an certain slayer level to weild an item
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Search your files for LevelReq somewhere there should be a list of possible LevelReq to use. In that section with the LevelReq will be the slayer one type it however it is. If you do not see a slayerLevelReq or one in general for slayer you will have to just make one for it.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How to make it so you need an certain slayer level to weild an item

item.title: [PI] How to make it so you need an certain slayer level to weild an item
item.dc:creator: @Eraa Eraa
item.description:
@Eraa wrote:

What do you mean? Everyone has a life and you have a future in computer programming. You’re very talented, anyways i got one error and I’ve read it but due to me being new to this stuff I cant really understand what it means?
here is the error if you could please help me with it

[code][code]src\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:568: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable slayerLevelReq
location: class server.model.items.ItemAssistant
c.attackLevelReq = c.defenceLevelReq = c.strengthLevelReq = c.ra
ngeLevelReq = c.magicLevelReq = slayerLevelReq = c.Donatorreq = 0;

                            ^

Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][/code]

I’m guessing it means it doesn’t know wthat slayerLevelReq means?

EDIT: FIXED I just needed to add a “c.” before the slayerLevelReq. :D, Silly me

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How to make it so you need an certain slayer level to weild an item
